intro: Rupicola apiculata, commonly known as the rock spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually greenish-yellow, and it produces a milky sap that can be toxic. Rupicola apiculata is often used in rock gardens due to its ability to thrive in well-drained soils and its ornamental value.
